page.title: 01Entrance to Olchon Valley
page.content: Olchon Valley is a dead end valley situated below the main Black Mountain ridge on the Easter Side. This glacial valley is blocked by Black Hill to the east and Hay Bluff to the north. Looking south down the valley it joins golden valley which runs down to Pontrilas on the main Hereford to Abergavenny road. Several remote farms are in evidence maily concerned with grazing cattle and ship. The ridges either side of the valley rise very steeply to over 2000 feet with many spring and feeder streams running into Olchon Brook on the valley floor. A public road runs along the valley to the Northern end on one side and passes over the brook at the extreme to return on the other side of the valley. A public right of way footpath links the 2 sides of the road loop at Beili-Bach to little Black Hill.
